meanings.definition: A chemotherapy drug used to treat various types of cancer.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed paclitaxel to fight the cancer cells.
meanings.sent2: Patients often receive paclitaxel as part of their cancer treatment.
meanings.sent3: The cancer cells were no match for the mighty paclitaxel!
meanings.sent4: Paclitaxel acted like a warrior, battling the cancer within the body.
meanings.sent5: The effectiveness of paclitaxel in treating cancer is well-known.

meanings.definition: The generic name for a medication derived from the Pacific yew tree.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist explained the origin of paclitaxel from the Pacific yew tree.
meanings.sent2: Some people are allergic to medications containing paclitaxel.
meanings.sent3: The Pacific yew tree must be proud to have paclitaxel as its derivative!
meanings.sent4: The history of paclitaxel traces back to the majestic Pacific yew tree.
meanings.sent5: The purity of paclitaxel sourced from nature is remarkable.

meanings.definition: A medication that works by stopping cancer cells from dividing and growing.
meanings.sent1: Paclitaxel inhibits the growth of cancer cells effectively.
meanings.sent2: Doctors monitor the progress of patients on paclitaxel treatment.
meanings.sent3: The cancer cells were like stubborn children, but paclitaxel was the strict parent!
meanings.sent4: In the battle against cancer, paclitaxel puts a halt to cell division.
meanings.sent5: The mechanism of action of paclitaxel is crucial in cancer therapy.
